messages.title: Fighting to stop Brexit
messages.content: Paul Follows and the Lib Dems are leading the fight against Brexit. Paul said, 'Whether it's Boris Johnson's deal or a Jeremy Corbyn deal, there is no deal as good as the one we already have as a member of the European Union. My first priority must be to stop a disastrous Brexit, but I will also fight to protect local health services, work to increase affordable housing and for real action on climate change.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lead the fight against Brexit to prevent a deal under Boris Johnson or Jeremy Corbyn, emphasizing the benefits of remaining in the EU.
Protect local services like schools and healthcare facilities.
Work to increase affordable housing and take real action on climate change.
Take urgent action to protect the environment, making Britain a world leader in renewable energy and green technology.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: INVEST IN SCHOOLS, OUR NHS, AND POLICING
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in the best schools, the NHS after years of Tory neglect, and provide more police in communities to make them safer.

issues.brexitEurope: Paul Follows and the Lib Dems are leading the fight against Brexit.
issues.environment: Take urgent action needed to protect our environment, making Britain a world leader in renewable energy and green technology.
issues.health: Invest in our NHS after years of Tory neglect.

leaflet.personalStatement: My first priority must be to stop a disastrous Brexit, but I will also fight to protect local health services, work to increase affordable housing and for real action on climate change.

quotes.text: 'Both Tories and Labour have failed the country'
'British politics is falling apart – the Tories are to blame, but Labour is also a shambles'

images.caption: Paul Follows walking in a market area wearing a ribbon indicating Liberal Democrats.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet includes a comparison between 'The Past' with criticisms of Tory and Labour parties and 'The Future' with a portrait of Jo Swinson and a message about the brighter future the Liberal Democrats promise.
